List of all members.

Detailed Description

The push button Widget.

A push button can fire an action when we hit the Return key when focused.

Definition at line 42 of file pushbutton.h.

Definition at line 93 of file pushbutton.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::PushButton::draw ( int  x,
int  y 
) [virtual]

The pure virtual draw method.

Every widget must subclass this method to be able to draw itself. The Layout call it for every widget.

The parameters tells the widget the position of the Window wich contains the widget. They are set by the Layout::Draw() with the Layout::setOrigin( int, int ) method parameters.

Parameters:
x The position of the window
y The position of the window

Implements RainbruRPG::Terminal::Widget.

Definition at line 97 of file pushbutton.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Terminal::PushButton::setAction ( FuncPtr  a  ) 

Set the action of the menu.

A typical use of this method :

First step is to declare and implement a C fuction that return a result different of -1. The -1 is reserved for menu that has not an action defined

 int item1Action(){
   // Your code here
   return 1; 
 }

The last step is to set a pointer to this function as parameter of thr setAction method. When this menuItem will be selected, it will call this function.

 MenuItem* it1=new MenuItem("&Identification");
 it1->setAction(&item1Action);

Parameters:
a the function pointer

Definition at line 174 of file pushbutton.cpp.

int RainbruRPG::Terminal::PushButton::fireAction (  ) 

Fire the action.

Return -1 if none action has been set, otherwise return the value of the pointed function.

Member Data Documentation

bool RainbruRPG::Terminal::Widget::canTakeFocus [protected, inherited]

This boolean is used to know if the widget can have the focus.

We can access this value with the canHaveFocus() function.

All the subclass of Widget must set this property to true or false. Typically, a Label can not have the focus, otherwise, a ListBox or a LineEdit must be able to have the focus.

Definition at line 80 of file widget.h.

int RainbruRPG::Terminal::Widget::x [protected, inherited]

The x coordonate of the widget.

This value is relative to the window top-left corner and cannot be inferior to 0.
